Reviews.Title: “Great location and cosy atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Iveraldo D
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Madrid in 2011 and I stayed in this hotel, right in front of the Gate of Toledo, just a few steps from the metro Puerta de Toledo, which is great when you want to tour around the city using public transport. The single room was comfortable and in the right measure. The bed was soft and the hot shower very relaxing. The bathroom was tiny, but that's not a problem for a single room and when you are traveling alone. I do recommend this hotel if you want a practical place to stay in Madrid. The staff was also very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, should improve wifi and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: traveling_geek_14
Reviews.Content: Good location, 15-20 minutes walking distance from most attractions, with metro stop very near. Rooms and bathrooms are small and furniture old, but very clean and serviced daily. The bed was comfortable, the air-conditioning can be controlled (on/off but also exact temperature!) - so I slept very well. It is true that the shower is quite small. On my stay the internet was on and off. The breakfast buffet is limited and unimaginative, the coffee terrible. Single rooms look onto small courtyard - so they are more quiet but the view is of walls and other windows. Has an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deniz U
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Puerta de Toledo four nights, June 2011. Hotel is in the best loaction of the Madrid. Rooms are very clean, and comfortable. Personel is very kind. Breakfast was excellent. So, I recommend Hotel Puerta de Toledo.

Reviews.Title: “Where to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: torontothoughts
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Puerto de Toledo Hotel in Madrid. It's a three star hotel that has clearly seen better days but it appears that a facelift is in the works. The elevator system is antiquated and everything seems worn. On the plus side, the location was ideal. We were within walking distance of the Puerto del Sol. The subway was a very short walk away and the #3 bus was just to the side of the hotel. Breakfasts were good and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would recommend it on the basis of the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Well located "Hotel Puerta de Toledo"”
Reviews.Author: FunMiami
Reviews.Content: well-located hotel, you can walk to major attractions without problem.The hotel a little old, needs renovations.Very friendly staff.Regular breakfast nothing special, just the basics for breakfast. Anyway thanks for everything.Thanks Hotel Puerta de Toledo.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: M Z
Reviews.Content: Great location, 15 min walk from Plaza Mayor. Fast check-in. Nice english speaking staff. Not the newest hotel but pleasant. Some upgrading works are in progress so it may look even better in the future. Good buffet breakfast. Metro stop right beside the hotel. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Large and Bustling Area Outside, Quiet and Modern Hotel Inside”
Reviews.Author: Clubess1
Reviews.Content: This hotel, if you are looking to walk/tour different areas of Madrid, is well placed. The nonstop activity and people-filled Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol are about 15 minutes away, "Old Madrid" with its narrow streets and diverse resident population is just as close, Parque Buen Retiro with its Palacio de Cristal and Monument a Alfonso XII, the Paseo del Prado (make sure to visit Centro de Arte Reina Sofia since it is FREE!), and the Palacio Real and its gardens are just a bit further. The staff here is very accommodating, sharing personal stories and favorite destinations, breakfast is more than sufficient, and the hallways and lobby are decorated in a very artistic fashion. The only shortcoming we found is that the lobby is not very inviting; there are only two, stiff-backed chairs which does not make it a place one might want to sit, chat, mingle, or people-watch. Be aware that this hotel is directly on a noisy roundabout (Puerta de Toledo) and a fire station. On the other hand, it is quite close to the Metro and bus stops. There are plans in the works to upgrade some of the services and rooms here, although we were quite happy with what we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “if you are on a budget this is highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MOBEN
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 10 nights last year and have great memories from the hotel. The service was great, you are 10 minutes walk from plaza mayor , there a a lot of coffee houses around, the rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: macrophage
Reviews.Content: Hotel Puerta de Toledo - Trip advisor For starters,  I traveled to Madrid unplanned because it was a spur of the moment thing so I reserved this hotel very quickly and while a few bad reviews made me think twice about it, I didn't paid any attention to it and it paid off.  First of all, this is not a fancy hotel nor a new or recently remoleded one, this hotel is just perfect for a solo traveler or a couple who isn't very picky, for me as a solo traveler, I'm not to fond of staying at hostels but don't have a lot of money for a pricey one but Hotel Puerta de Toledo fits just perfectly. The prices is in the range of a Motel 6 and has every basic thing: a bed, closet, bathroom, hot shower, television and an elevator.  It is quite conviently located a few meters away from the metro station and a kilometer or two from Plaza Mayor, the heart of the city.  To get there from the Barajas Airport, you must take the metro all the way to Mar de Cristal station, then take the number 4 (brown) line to Argüelles and get off Alonso Martinez station and then take number 5 (green) line to Casa de Campo and get off at Puerta de Toledo station and on to your left you will the hotel. I recommed to purchase a "abono turistico" ticket at the airport, with it you can freely use the metro and bus in the city for three, five or seven days, it is a very money-saver!  Some of the rooms have a very distinct smell of old so for the faint of heart I recommend to use a room deodorant that can be easily bought in a store or better yer bring one from the US, obviously much cheaper, and just plug it in the electrical outlet just don't forget to  buy your American-European converter because it will cost you double in Spain. Buy one from eBay, they're so cheap it's ridiculous and they work nicely.  One of the best things is the hotel staff, they're very kind and welcoming, it just feels like a bed and breakfast, and they will help you with any questions you may have. Also, it is just a brisk fifteen minute wal to the cathedral, royal palace and plaza mayor but be wary of pick pockets because there are a lot of people walking in the afternoons and especially tourists who are easily distracted.  The drawbacks is that it is a bit noisy because of the streets and the other rooms so, if you can, request a room from the back, those are less noisy, and the shower is so small I barely fit into it and I'm not overweight or very tall, just average but remember that this hotel was made a few decades ago so it will have a few drawbacks.  Overall, I recommend this hotel for all travelers who just want a nice, private and centric room at good price. I will defintely will reserve again in this hotel next time I visit Madrid.  FYI, "Madrileños" are a bit rude by nature so they will serve you in such a way that it would be considered unpleasant by most standards but don't take it personal, that is the way they are.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: FoylesWar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 16 OCT - 05 NOV 2011 and had a double room on the outside of the hotel facing the roundabout directly above the taxi stand. There was a mix-up with my reservation as the travel agent booked a double room and I was traveling alone. When I asked to change to a single room at the reception, they would not let me change and said it was because of the commission they had to pay to the travel agent. I thought they should have tried a bit harder to find a way to accommodate my request, including letting me pay the higher commission out of pocket. The room was clean, the bathroom large but the air conditioning was not functioning at this time of year. So I had to open the window and the noise of a big city at night was enough to keep me awake and wake me during the night. Emergency vehicles responding to calls from their station just down the street with their sirens blaring were just the beginning of many sounds that came wafting into the room through the window. My colleagues were in single rooms in the interior and had almost no ventilation even with the window wide open. They also had a very small, corner shower in the single rooms that made it difficult to turn around in the shower. Breakfast was good and I felt at a reasonable price. The menu never changed though. The internet connection, while free was rubbish. There were times when it was so slow as to be completely useless. One of my colleagues have relocated to another hotel due to the continuing problems they have with the internet connection. The garage is very small. I would recommend their shuttle service to the airport. It cost 30 Euro for two of us which we split. Much cheaper than a taxi. Make sure you request it a day or two before you need it. There is no mini-refrigerator in the room, so forget going to the grocery store and saving some money on food. There is a small safe in the room, but it costs 1 Euro each time you use it. The location just across from the metro station and several bus stops. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. If I go back to Madrid for business, I will probably try another hotel as this one was just adequate and for the money I was paying, I can get adequate much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DNG6711
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed from 16-22 August 2011. The triple room is just enough to fit the 3 pax. The room and toilet are clean and well kept with free internet connection. Breakfast was pretty decent. Location is easy to find and near the Mrt. A bus ride home from the center. There are also some nearby restaurants with good food. Walking distance to Royal Palace. Reception Staffs are helpful and will assist you whenever you need a ride from & going to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make the stay memorable”
Reviews.Author: alison w
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June 2011. It is well placed for a City Break but there was traffic noise all night due to our room overlooking a busy road junction. Breakfast was very good with lots of fresh fruit, sweet breads and cakes as well as hot and cold savoury food. The reception staff were helpful and friendly and the bedroom/bathroom was acceptable and adequate for this type of holiday. The décor and furnishings are a little dated but it is after all a middle of the road ( literally) city centre hotel with a high turnover of guests. You get what you pay for here and most business guests and sightseers will only use it as a base. Good bed, good shower, good breakfast, good staff. What more do you need.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Central ,the hotel is simple and clean - good value !”
Reviews.Author: Elizur
Reviews.Content: Staff is very attentive to your desires , location is excellent , hotel is clean and the rooms are nice and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Good cost-benefit”
Reviews.Author: cloyola
Reviews.Content: Very close to metro station and the employees is very helpful. Breakfast could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Puerta to Perfection”
Reviews.Author: nm87114
Reviews.Content: I think that this hotel is a great buy for those on a budget but on the look out for a nice experience. Staff speaks English and is very helpful (I suggest that you take the tourist train thru Madrid as it doubles as sightseeing and legitmate means of transportation) and is open to field questions on just about anything. Only drawback is the hotel is packed with other tourists so it can get very busy at times. Maid services is prompt and through as this serves a welcome addition from previous hotels in France.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: abqlolo
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms; comparable to what you might find in the U.S. Room was clean. Bathroom was clean. No real issues with noise due to the Puerta del Sol roundabout. Great location; walking distance to Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Royal Palace. Adjacent to metro station. My wife very much enjoyed the Hotel. Service was good; everyone at the front desk spoke English. We'd book again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Etyram
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the hotel one year ago, but Im quite sure, nothing has changed much since then. The hotel itself is very average. Very basic with polite staff. I was staying in a twin room. The room was pretty small, but the bathroom was big enough and nice. My sleep in this hotel could be better, because walls are thin. Could hear my neighbors, that were staying late, really well... Should mention as well, that other colleagues, that were staying in another room "on a corner of the building" complained about the noise they heard from a street (like beepers of a semaphore all night long...). As for cleanness - generally everything was clean, but some upper shelves, or around a TV dust was "forgotten" in a quite a layer (anyway, my colleague with whom I shared a room didnt even notice). Breakfast was continental, but again, nothing special. I would recommend this hotel, for non pretentious people.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was basic clean,with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: johnz10
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel,only about 10 min walk from the royal palace,which is well worth a walk round the staff on the desk were very helpful,and even helped to speak to our airlines lost baggage centre when our bags got lost rooms were basic,but nice and clean,could of done with an extra pillow and blanket/sheet the one thing i do recomend you dont do,is go to the resturant adjoining the hotel,we went there on the 1st night,it was ok,until we saw several COCKROACHES crawling out of the windows frames

Reviews.Title: “good value - noisy location”
Reviews.Author: margarette
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days and found the hotel modern and clean and the room a good size with a bath - shower over the bath and plenty of hot water. The breakfast for a 3 star hotel was excellent - much better than other 3 star hotels I have stayed in for city breaks. The only drawback for us wast he location right on a very busy intersection. The room faced onto the road and the traffic noise went on for most of the night. They do have rooms which face onto a courtyard but the reception staff could not seem to understand about the noise as they are used to it. As we were only staying 3 nights decided not make a fuss and stayed put although our sleep was disturbed. The hotel is within walking distance of all the sights as long as you are fit as it is a good walk - 20 mins or so. However the metro is nearby if you need it. Madrid has lots to offer - check out the free times of opening for the art galleries in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Solo Traveler”
Reviews.Author: sodagembira
Reviews.Content: Single room is clean and enough for 1 person, unless have huge body size. Hotel provide internet wifi, AC, TV, good breakfast. Distance to the city center is great, very close to the metro and easy to get taxi or food. There is scale for luggage, which also useful. Reception staff are speak good english and professional. They all very helpful (especially the one name Gonzales). The hotel price is reasonable. One problem is the wall were not thick enough. Sounds from outside can be heard.

Reviews.Title: “First time in a Madrid Hotel, and I was satisfeid”
Reviews.Author: noble-taste
Reviews.Content: Located a few minutes away from the city centre, the hotel is just across the road from Puerta de Toledo metro, on the same line of Gran via which is the centre of Madrid and it only takes about 10 minutes to reach it. The area is not so noisy and not so busy, however at night some noise from sirens can be heard from the room. Staff was nice and spoke a little English. In Spain the language is a huge problem and few can speak English or Italian, and for those who think that Italian is similar to Spanish, they're mistaken. Rooms were clean and everything worked well. The room was large enough to accomodate us well. Breakfast was good with a selection of bread, ham, cheese, yogart, cereals, pastry ecc. I may return to this hotel since for just €32.50 a night per person, it is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: t_style
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the hotel in July and our family liked the place. The hotel is nice and clean and the surroundings are ok. Puerta de Toledo is right outside the door. The rooms were a bit small, but we managed to fit in with two adults and two, 6 and 10 year old boys quite nicely. The breakfast was nice and there was good selection of different options. The lack of swimming pool would have been a problem for the children, if our stay would have been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ascoli
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Location right in front of the Puerta De toledo underground! Practically in walking distance to most of the museums! Staff friendly and helpful! Hotel rooms spotless and a great breakfast.! What more for a three star hotel?? Not satisfied pay up and go to the Ritz!!!

Reviews.Title: “spotlessly clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: needtotravel1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in february 2008. The hotel is rated as a 3 star and rightly so. When we arrived we were welcomed by a friendly member of staff who had a very good grasp of english; which we were relieved to hear as we barely had a word of spanish between us! Check in was quick and he even gave us some maps and info on the city. Our room was clean and comfortable, not that we spent much time in it anyway since there are so many fantastic things to see and do in madrid. Breakfast consisted of the usual continental selection of toast, rolls, ham, cheese, cereal, etc and was included in our room rate. Very tasty overall. The hotel is located slightly outside the city centre and is about a 20 minute or so walk to the beautiful Plaza Mayor. A metro station is situated only a minutes walk away from the hotel too, which is extremey handy. As other reviewers have mentioned however, staying just outside the city centre is not neccessarily a bad thing as madrid can get very busy at night and some may prefer the hotel's relatively quieter location. Overall this is an excellent 3 star hotel and a perfect base from which to explore this incredible city. Highly recommened as long as you don't mind not being right in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cwhitele
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful with the Toledo Gate in the front. Our room faced the gate and it was just so awesome. Very close walk to the Metro and if you want to catch the Madrid Vision tours, you had a short walk right across from the fire station. I loved it there, at night the Toledo Gate was also so beautiful! On the same side of the Hotel sidewalk on the West side of building you would find ATM, and a wonderful Pub with fantastic people who worked there (Valle Kanne) and across the street was the Farmacia. I highly recommend Hotel Puerta Toledo and I will definately go back there!

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: arabella22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little out of the way. But bus stops are right next to the hotel that can take you to all the major sights. Buses are only 1 euro each way and come every 5-10 mins. The metro was also close by as well. This Hotel was clean, had air conditioning and was quite. Staff was very helpful and spoke English. If you are an extra large person then you will not fit into the shower. Very small.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, food disastrous!”
Reviews.Author: GabiHungary
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Madrid in Hotel Puerta de Toledo for one week in July 2008. The hotel is in a good location, "far from the madding crowd":). It's in a nice place, far enough from the center of Madrid to get a good sleep but close enough by metro to get "home" quickly. The single rooms don't face the street - they all face te inner side - which is not really a disadvantage because you cannot even hear the noise of the street at night, so it's calm and silent. But don't open the window, because the smell of the food comes into your room from the restaurant below. The room was clean but with very old furniture, I needed to buy shower gel because I got daily such a small "bottle" that wasn't enough for anything. The staff was average, not particularly friendly, but not friendly either, I have seen some fake smiles. The breakfast was the worst thing is this hotel. We always got the same types of food every day, and I must confess that the last two mornings I felt sick because of the food. The "hot" dishes were some little sausages (they didn't really look well, so I didn't taste them), I have also seen some green (!) sausages as well and some very fat meat. The rolls were stale every morning, coffee, orange juice, cakes OK, but the cups were also very old and used. Unfortunately food is very important for me, so this ruined everything.

Reviews.Title: “If Cost is Your Only Consideration! (Los Angeles, CA)”
Reviews.Author: Free2Trvl
Reviews.Content: Landing in Madrid on a red-eye flight from the US...I arrived at the Hotel Puerta de Toledo (via taxi) and was instantly greeted by friendly english speaking staff. They were quick with the check-in and provided basic info on the local neighborhood, etc. Once I got up to my room I got a slight dose of 2-star reality! The room was very clean, however lets just say their isn't much that requires cleaning. Besides a bed, very small desk, and a small TV thats mounted on a ledge in front of the bed, thats the extent of the in-room amenities. Their was only one bed pillow and no extra in the closet. Their are in-room safes for 1 euro per use. The bathroom was the most memorable experience, as the shower is the smallest shower I have ever seen/used. I believe one reviewer commented on hitting his knees when moving around, which was very true. The hotel also provides air conditioning, however in my room the vent was adjusted so as to blow directly onto the bed. Their is a complimentary continental breakfast, however their were only cold options (cereal, pastries, etc), during my stay. The hotel does have a cafe next door, which is good to grab a cappuccino, as they only provide coffee at the hotel. The location is another matter. The hotel to my surprise was located about a 30 minute brisk walk to most attractions or 3-4 metro station stops. However, their is a train station (Puerta de Toledo) just up the street. Overall this is of good value if your bottom line is cost, but you definitely sacrifice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JPSaleebyMD
Reviews.Content: The Puerta de Toledo met our budget for our trip to Europe (Spain was our last stop). We asked for a triple as my wife's son would join us. He was studying in Spain and his command of the language was very helpful. Room was on the 6th floor with a wonderful view of the Puerta de Toledo monument (arch). Location was yards from a metro station that was the way to get around Madrid. The city was much cleaner and more ordered (traffic wise) than I expected. Only disappointment was with much of the wait-staff in restaurants, where if you could not speak Spanish.. there was a lot of eye-rolling and sighing on their part. Wish they had been as friendly and helpful as the Italians. Breakfast was GREAT! Lots of choices and it certainly made the say. Beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were more of what we see in the US (excluding the bidet).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid booking a single in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: coventgarden
Reviews.Content: If you visit Madrid as a sinlge traveller avoid booking a single in this hotel. The room was a prison cell, outdated and with a tiny shower room. The shower was so small you could not move once inside it without hiting your knees and elbows. Furniture old, wallpaper pilling off and hairdryer broken. Breakfast it the hotel was cold buffet only. Double bedrooms looked much better, but, overall, this is best described as a 2 star hotel, 1 star for its single bedrooms. Location is good if you do not mind using the metro (3 stops from Gran Via) or a 15-20 min walk. Avoid the cafeteria on the ground floor at all costs, it is junk. Head to the centre instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Puerta de Toledo”
Reviews.Author: Anna11London
Reviews.Content: Really excellent value for money! Rooms spotlessly clean and quiet. Great location, a stone's throw from the metro. The buffet breakfast definitely a winner, everything fresh and bountiful. In our case it was included which added to the overall experience. I agree, the staff could make an effort to come across slightly more amiable but... we can't always have our cake and eat it! I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Better late than never...”
Reviews.Author: Shauny_A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is of a good tourist standard. The rooms were clean and of a high modern standard. The buffet breakfast was varied and included some hot options. There is a small street level cafe at the front offering views of the square. The nearest Metro is just across the other side of the roundabout from the front of the hotel making it a quick journey into the centre of Madrid. We walked back from the centre a couple of times at night without any problems and it took about 30 mins. Overall if you'd like to stay outside the centre of Madrid then this is certainly an option.

Reviews.Title: “There's a Hair in There”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will start this review with the positive attributes of this hotel: the staff are extremely friendly and helpful and very knowledgeable, there is one computer with free Internet access, the reception area looks attractive and there is a small cafe next door that does great jamon & tomato sandwiches. Now the negative points I'm afraid: the hotel is rather old and it is being to seriously show its age. We asked for non smoking rooms and got smoking rooms that were quite shabby. The smell of smoke was very overpowering in the room it seemed to have been embedded in the curtains and all the furnishings and also appeared to come through the aircon system. The shower was also very tiny and here we come to the issue of cleanliness. I located several hairs in the bathroom in general, specifically in the shower recess and also in the bed. My friend also found several dead moths in his room. This might be perhaps expected in a backpackers' hostel but not in a 3 star establishment. The mornings were pretty noisy too with the maids being very loud in their conversations when we were still sleeping (around 7.30am). The hotel location is also not that central, we had to walk for half an hour before reaching the main Madrid city centre. I suggest the hotel closes for total renovation and then I might be prepared to visit it again but only because of the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “what it must be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: it is clean, cheap enough, in an excellent position, internet for free, unfortuantely people is allwed to smoke along the corridor. Shower is a bit too small for me.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel puerta de Toledo saved the day!!”
Reviews.Author: waso
Reviews.Content: What would have been a disaster, ended up being a wonderful last day in Madrid. First, my luggage never made it to Europe. One bag somhow made it around our southern states; I still can't figure that one out . I was searched from the time I arrived at the airport in Detroit, onto the International flight from Chicago, finally from Germany onto Spain. A total of six times; shoes and all. Needless to say I wasn't very happy to find out, not only did my luggage not make it, but they even ended up on a totally different airline carrier. Go figure. My first nine days in Spain was spent outside of the city in a hotel that was not so friendly. When I finally did make it back to the city I couldn't wait to get to the Hotel Puerta de Toledo. You see, these people have been taking care of my reservations for over a year now. I've had the pleasure of staying at their hotel for four different trips this past year. The last two however, have been for only a day. This is because my business takes me outside of the city far enough that it's impossible for me to travel back in forth everyday on business. I love the way they treat this American. From the bar next door to the fine dinning in the lower level of the hotel. The gentleman that work at the front desk are some of the most friendly men I've ever met. I only want to stay at this hotel when I visit this country and the city of Madrid. I hope to see them all next month for the Christmas Holidays. Chao They truly respect your privacy from the Do Not disturb sign

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Puerta de Toledo
HotelInfo.Address: Glorieta Puerta de Toledo, 4, 28005 Madrid, Spain
